original_solution_mapping.L1: If he gathers for 2 hours, the number of minutes gathering is 2 * 60 minutes per hour = <<2*60=120>>120 minutes of gathering flowers
original_solution_mapping.L2: Gathering for 120 minutes / 10 minutes per flower = <<120/10=12>>12 flowers gathered
original_solution_mapping.L3: If he gathers 12 flowers initially but lost 3, he has 12-3 = <<12-3=9>>9 flowers gathered and kept
original_solution_mapping.L4: Since he has 30 classmates total and has 9 flowers, he needs to gather 30-9=<<30-9=21>>21 more flowers
original_solution_mapping.L5: Assuming it takes 10 minutes per flower, it will take him 10 * 21 = <<10*21=210>>210 minutes to gather the remaining 21 flowers needed

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6677.
    Returns: the number of additional minutes Justin needs to look for flowers.
    """
    # L1
    hours_gathering = 2 # 2 hours
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    minutes_gathering = hours_gathering * minutes_per_hour

    # L2
    minutes_per_flower = 10 # 10 minutes to find a flower
    flowers_gathered_initial = minutes_gathering / minutes_per_flower

    # L3
    flowers_lost = 3 # lost 3 of the flowers
    flowers_kept = flowers_gathered_initial - flowers_lost

    # L4
    total_classmates = 30 # 30 classmates
    flowers_needed_additional = total_classmates - flowers_kept

    # L5
    minutes_needed_additional = minutes_per_flower * flowers_needed_additional

    # FA
    answer = minutes_needed_additional
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If he gathers for {hours_gathering} hours, the number of minutes gathering is {hours_gathering} * {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour = <<{hours_gathering}*{minutes_per_hour}={minutes_gathering}>>{minutes_gathering} minutes of gathering flowers

Gathering for {minutes_gathering} minutes / {minutes_per_flower} minutes per flower = <<{minutes_gathering}/{minutes_per_flower}={flowers_gathered_initial}>>{flowers_gathered_initial} flowers gathered

If he gathers {flowers_gathered_initial} flowers initially but lost {flowers_lost}, he has {flowers_gathered_initial}-{flowers_lost} = <<{flowers_gathered_initial}-{flowers_lost}={flowers_kept}>>{flowers_kept} flowers gathered and kept

Since he has {total_classmates} classmates total and has {flowers_kept} flowers, he needs to gather {total_classmates}-{flowers_kept}=<<{total_classmates}-{flowers_kept}={flowers_needed_additional}>>{flowers_needed_additional} more flowers

Assuming it takes {minutes_per_flower} minutes per flower, it will take him {minutes_per_flower} * {flowers_needed_additional} = <<{minutes_per_flower}*{flowers_needed_additional}={minutes_needed_additional}>>{minutes_needed_additional} minutes to gather the remaining {flowers_needed_additional} flowers needed
